Package com.atakmap.opengl

Class GLRenderBatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.opengl.GLRenderBatch
  • @Deprecated
@DeprecatedApi(since="5.3",
               forRemoval=true,
               removeAt="5.6")
public final class GLRenderBatch
extends java.lang.Object
    Deprecated.
    use GLRenderBatch2
    A batching implementation for efficient rendering of geometry and textures.

    General usage of this class is as follows:

    • beginBatch()
    • add geometry/texture (many times)
    • endBatch()
    In the best case, all content that is added will be rendered in a single draw invocation when #endBatch() is invoked. A periodic flush may be required between #beginBatch() and #endBatch() when content is added if the capacity of the render buffer has been exhausted or if the maximum number of available texture units are already in use.

    All methods should be invoked on the GL context thread unless specified otherwise.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GLRenderBatch

        public GLRenderBatch​(int capacity)
        Deprecated.
        Creates a new sprite batch.
        Parameters:
        capacity - The maximum number of sprites that may be batched before a flush is required. Note that a flush may need to occur more frequently if triangle or triangle strip sprites are added to the batch.

      • GLRenderBatch

        public GLRenderBatch​(GLRenderBatch2 impl)
        Deprecated.

    • Method Detail

      • begin

        public void begin()
        Deprecated.
        Begins a new batch. The various methods to add sprites may be invoked after this method returns.

      • end

        public void end()
        Deprecated.
        Ends the current batch. Any batched content will be rendered.

      • flush

        protected void flush()
        Deprecated.
        Renders any currently batched content. The sprite buffer will be cleared before this method returns.

      • addSprite

        public void addSprite​(int textureId,
                      float x1,
                      float y1,
                      float x2,
                      float y2,
                      float u1,
                      float v1,
                      float u2,
                      float v2,
                      float r,
                      float g,
                      float b,
                      float a)
        Deprecated.
        Adds the specified sprite to the batch.
        Parameters:
        textureId - The sprite's texture ID
        x1 - The upper-left vertex x
        y1 - The upper-left vertex y
        x2 - The lower-right vertex x
        y2 - The lower-right vertex y
        u1 - The upper-left texture u
        v1 - The upper-left texture v
        u2 - The lower-right texture u
        v2 - The lower-right texture v
        r - The red component for the color of the sprite
        g - The green component for the color of the sprite
        b - The blue component for the color of the sprite
        a - The alpha component for the color of the sprite

      • addTrianglesSprite

        public void addTrianglesSprite​(int textureId,
                               java.nio.FloatBuffer vertexCoords,
                               java.nio.FloatBuffer texCoords,
                               float r,
                               float g,
                               float b,
                               float a)
        Deprecated.
        Adds the specified sprite to the sprite buffer. The provided vertex and texture coordinates are expected to be consistent with a draw mode of GLES20Constants.GL_TRIANGLES. The coordinate buffers are required to have the same number of elements remaining.
        Parameters:
        textureId - The sprite's texture ID
        vertexCoords - The vertex coordinates
        texCoords - The texture coordinates
        r - The red component for the color of the sprite
        g - The green component for the color of the sprite
        b - The blue component for the color of the sprite
        a - The alpha component for the color of the sprite

      • addTriangleStripSprite

        public void addTriangleStripSprite​(int textureId,
                                   java.nio.FloatBuffer vertexCoords,
                                   java.nio.FloatBuffer texCoords,
                                   float r,
                                   float g,
                                   float b,
                                   float a)
        Deprecated.
        Adds the specified sprite to the sprite buffer. The provided vertex and texture coordinates are expected to be consistent with a draw mode of GLES20Constants.GL_TRIANGLE_STRIP; degenerate triangles are accepted. The coordinate buffers are required to have the same number of elements remaining.
        Parameters:
        textureId - The sprite's texture ID
        vertexCoords - The vertex coordinates
        texCoords - The texture coordinates
        r - The red component for the color of the sprite
        g - The green component for the color of the sprite
        b - The blue component for the color of the sprite
        a - The alpha component for the color of the sprite

      • addTriangleFanSprite

        public void addTriangleFanSprite​(int textureId,
                                 java.nio.FloatBuffer vertexCoords,
                                 java.nio.FloatBuffer texCoords,
                                 float r,
                                 float g,
                                 float b,
                                 float a)
        Deprecated.
        Adds the specified sprite to the sprite buffer. The provided vertex and texture coordinates are expected to be consistent with a draw mode of GLES20Constants.GL_TRIANGLE_FAN; degenerate triangles are accepted. The coordinate buffers are required to have the same number of elements remaining.
        Parameters:
        textureId - The sprite's texture ID
        vertexCoords - The vertex coordinates
        texCoords - The texture coordinates
        r - The red component for the color of the sprite
        g - The green component for the color of the sprite
        b - The blue component for the color of the sprite
        a - The alpha component for the color of the sprite
